edu.uic.cs.dmtm.apriori

Class APriori

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uic.cs.dmtm.apriori.APriori

  • public class APriori
extends java.lang.Object
    Java application running the Multiple Minimum Support A Priori algorithm on a transaction base. The basic A Priori algorithm performs association rule mining as follows:
    • identify frequent individual items
    • generate higher-dimension item sets
        maintain only frequent items and item sets

      The Multiple Minimum Support is a generalization of the A Priori algorithm that allows to specify the minsup threshold separately for each item.

      This version also provides two more constraints:

      • on items that can not be together in the same itemset
      • on items that must be present in an itemset to be considered
    Author:
    Marco Mele, Massimo Piras

      • generateCandidates

        private static java.util.TreeSet<Itemset> generateCandidates(java.util.TreeSet<Itemset> F,
                                                             java.util.ArrayList<Itemset> cannotBeTogetherItemsets,
                                                             java.lang.Double SDC)
                                                      throws DifferentItemsetSizeException,
                                                             NonJoinableItemsetsException
        Generates all candidate k-itemsets joining frequent (k-1)-itemsets; then applies the cannot-be-together rule for pruning.
        Parameters:
        F - A TreeSet of frequent (k-1)-itemsets.
        cannotBeTogetherItemsets - An ArrayList of itemsets representing the cannot-be-together rules.
        SDC -
        Returns:
        A TreeSet of the leve-2 candidate Itemsets
        Throws:
        NonJoinableItemsetsException
        DifferentItemsetSizeException

        A TreeSet of the frequent k-itemsets.

      • generateL

        private static java.util.TreeSet<Itemset> generateL(java.util.TreeSet<Itemset> candidates)
                                             throws NoFrequentItemsetsException
        Generate the set of 1-itemsets with support greater than, or equal to, the MIS of the first frequent Itemset, from the list of 1-itemsets.
        Parameters:
        candidates - A TreeSet of 1-itemsets.
        Returns:
        A TreeSet the set of 1-items that respect the given frequency threshold.
        Throws:
        NoFrequentItemsetsException

      • generateLevel2Candidates

        private static java.util.TreeSet<Itemset> generateLevel2Candidates(java.util.TreeSet<Itemset> L,
                                                                   java.util.ArrayList<Itemset> cannotBeTogetherItemsets,
                                                                   java.lang.Double SDC)
                                                            throws NonJoinableItemsetsException,
                                                                   DifferentItemsetSizeException
        Generates all frequent 2-itemsets from all 1-itemsets in a set L that have support greater than, or equal to, a threshold defined as the MIS of the first frequent item; then applies the cannot-be-together rule for pruning.
        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        NoFrequentItemsetsException,
                        DifferentItemsetSizeException,
                        NonJoinableItemsetsException
        The main application running the MSAPriori algorithm.
        Parameters:
        args - no command line arguments are taken.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when I/O system error occur or input files have bad formatted lines; this is considered fatal and aborts the execution.
        NoFrequentItemsetsException - only caught by the application when no higher-size itemsets can be produced; otherwise rises from a data error and aborts the execution.
        DifferentItemsetSizeException - arises when the algorithm mistakenly joins itemsets of different sizes; this should never occur and thus is considered fatal and aborts the execution.
        NonJoinableItemsetsException - arises when the algorithm mistakenly joins itemsets that can't be joined together; this should never occur and thus is considered fatal and aborts the execution.

      • supportAndTailCounter

        private static void supportAndTailCounter(java.util.ArrayList<Itemset> transactions,
                                          java.util.TreeSet<Itemset> candidates,
                                          int N)
        Computes the support count and the tail count of all itemsets in a given ArrayList with respect to all the transactions.
        Parameters:
        transactions - An ArrayList of all the transaction in the dataset.
        candidates - A TreeSet of the candidates on which to perform the count.
        N - The total number of transactions.
